Location.Description: You are in Sugarsand Station, a small local candy store. You are at a crowded wooden counter, so cluttered with jars of licorice, sugar sticks, and boxes of suckers that there's barely any place to do business. An old cash register rests behind the counter, looking like an antique from the 1920's or even earlier. It doesn't appear as though the store has made a profit in a generation, but maybe whoever runs it simply does it out of the good of his or her heart. Or perhaps there's something more sinister at play, you think, eyeing some ginger bread men cookies preserved in a glass frame hanging on the wall, each with a name written below...
